test_case.title: Text and Icon Verification in Spotlight Search for 'k' Input
pre_condition: User has any Mac device with macOS 11 (Big Sur), macOS 12 (Monterey), macOS 13 (Ventura), or macOS 14 (Sonoma) with an operational Spotlight Search.

steps.action: Open Spotlight Search by pressing 'Command' (âŒ˜) and 'Space' keys simultaneously.
steps.expected_result: Spotlight Search opens in the middle of the screen.

steps.action: Enter the letter 'k' in the search field.
steps.expected_result: The letter 'k' is inputted into the search field.

steps.action: Verify that the text 'keynote.app - Open' appears on the left side of the search field.
steps.expected_result: The text 'keynote.app - Open' is displayed on the left side of the search field.

steps.action: Confirm that the app icon for Keynote is displayed on the right side of the search field.
steps.expected_result: The app icon for Keynote is visible on the right side of the search field.

steps.action: Verify that all information is displayed on the left side inside of the dropdown list.
steps.expected_result: All information in the dropdown list is visible on the left side.

steps.action: In the dropdown list, verify that the first displayed items are: Keynote.app, Keychain Access.app, Keyboard.
steps.expected_result: The dropdown list shows the specified items, starting with Keynote.app, Keychain Access.app, and Keyboard.
